LAUNDERING.Definition: (of money) the process of making illegal money seem like it is real

DISCLAIMER.Definition: a formal statement where you say you are not responsible for something

UNDERWORLD.Definition: the criminals in a particular place

INCENTIVES.Definition: things that encourage you to do something

GANGSTER.Definition: a member of an organised criminal gang

LAUNDROMATS.Definition: shops where you can pay to use a washing or drying machine

LAUNDER.Definition: (of money) make illegal money seem legal

GAMBLING.Definition: when you risk money to potentially get more, e.g. on a card game

EXTORTION.Definition: to force someone to give you something by threatening them

CASH.Definition: money in the form of notes or coins

BUMPER PROFIT.Definition: a very large profit, a large amount of money gained

PROFITABLE.Definition: making more in income than paying in costs

PROFITS.Definition: money that is left in a business after costs

AROUSE.Definition: if you arouse suspicion, people become suspicious of you

PLACEMENT.Definition: the process of putting money into the financial system

LAYERING.Definition: the process of moving money around the financial system

INTEGRATION.Definition: the process of taking money out of the financial system and transforming it into an asset

CHIPS.Definition: a small, normally plastic coin used in casinos

BOBâ€™S YOUR UNCLE.Definition: (British English) used to show that something can be done easily

CASHIER.Definition: someone whose job is to take money in a shop

MONEY TRAIL.Definition: the record of where money has gone

ASSOCIATE.Definition: make a connection in your mind

PAYDAY.Definition: the day when you are paid

GREEDY.Definition: having a wish to have more of something

GOT AWAY WITH.Definition: to succeed in doing something without being caught

FISHY.Definition: if something seems fishy, it looks dishonest or bad

WHITE COLLAR.Definition: relating to people who work in offices doing knowledge work, rather than manual work

GREASE.Definition: a thick oily substance that helps things move smoothly

CLAMP DOWN.Definition: to take a firm action on something, e.g. a crime

CRACKING DOWN.Definition: to become more strict in dealing with something

CRYPTOCURRENCIES.Definition: a digital currency that uses encryption, e.g. Bitcoin

MAINSTREAM.Definition: considered normal, or accepted by large parts of society

WAGED.Definition: if a complaint is waged at you, it is made at you

DARK WEB.Definition: the part of the Internet that is only accessible using special software

AIM.Definition: your aim is what you want to achieve
